subdistro.title: Fedora
subdistro.desc:
# Fedora

Fedora is a community-driven distribution sponsored by Red Hat. It serves as a cutting-edge testing ground for technologies that eventually make their way into Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL). Fedora is known for its commitment to free and open-source software and its embrace of the latest advancements in the Linux ecosystem.

Features

  • Bleeding-Edge Technologies: Fedora often includes the latest software versions and technologies, making it an ideal choice for users who want to experience new features early.
  • Regular Release Cycle: Fedora follows a regular release cycle, with new versions typically every six months. This allows users to stay current with the latest developments.
  • Diverse Spins: Fedora offers different desktop environments known as spins, catering to various user preferences, including Workstation, KDE Plasma, XFCE, and more.

Pros and Cons

Pros:

  • Bleeding-edge technologies,
  • Regular release cycle,
  • Diverse spins.

Cons:

  • Shorter support lifecycle,
  • May encounter bugs.
